page.title: 16HOBBIES AND INTERESTS
page.content: Traditional crafts have always been a feature of rural life and these skills have assumed a new importance today. Many of the older women are proficient in weaving, tapestry, crochet, patch- work, lace-making etc. and younger wo- men are anxious to learn. In Kingston, ladies meet weekly for a social work- ing hour. Gardening, too, is popular, many people preferring to grow their own produce, and there is friendly competition at the local horticultural shows. Jams, pickles and chutneys are still made, but freezing seems to have replaced other methods of preserving. Many people's interests extend beyond what is available in their own village and opportunities exist to participate in music, art, sport, and a wide range of courses provided by the Adult Educ- ation Dept. Theatres, concert halls and cinemas are within easy reach.
